intro: Antirhea surigaoensis, commonly known as the Surigao antirhea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its ornamental foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces clusters of white or pale yellow blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
